definitions.definition: accepting in a sensible way what it is actually possible to do or achieve in a particular situation
definitions.sensetop: realistic about somethingit is realistic (for somebody) to do something

examples.text: a realistic assessment/approach/view
We have to be realistic about our chances of winning.
It is not realistic to expect people to spend so much money.
examples.contextForm: it is realistic (for somebody) to do something

examples.text: It would not be realistic for the Government to demand a pay freeze in the sector at this point.
He was realistic enough to know this success could not last.
My friends were quite realistic about my problems.
You're not being very realistic in your expectations.

phrases: it is not realistic to expect, think, etc. something
